bgameb.stuff module

Game dices, coins, cards and other stuffs

class bgameb.stuff.RollerType(name: Optional[str] = None, sides: int = 2)[source]

Bases: BaseStuff

Base class for define types of rollers or fliped objects

If name isn’t given - it is randomly generated.

Define name to identify later this object by unique name. For example: ‘six_side_dice’

Sides attr define number of sides of roller. Default to 2. Sides can’t be less than 2, because one-sided roller is strongly determined and 0zero-sided is imposible.

Example:
    dice = RollerType(name='coin', sides=2)
Raises

StuffDefineError – number of sides less than 2

name: Optional[str] = None
sides: int = 2
class bgameb.stuff.Roller(name: Optional[str] = None, sides: int = 2, count: int = 0)[source]

Bases: RollerType

Creare the roller (like dice or coin)

count: int = 0

Bases: BaseStuff

Create the card

If name isn’t given - it is randomly generated.

    card = CardType(name='unique_card')

flip() → None[source]

Face up or face down the card regardles of it condition

face_up() → None[source]

Face up the card and return text

face_down() → None[source]

Face down the card

tap(side='right') → None[source]

Tap the card to the given side

Parameters

side (str, optional) – sifde to tap. Defaults to ‘right’.

untap() → None[source]

Untap the card

alter() → None[source]

Many cards have alter views. For example card can have main view, that apply most time of the game and second view, that apply only if card played as that alternative. For ease of understanding, consider that different views of the same card are not related directly to each other.

attach() → None[source]

Some rules can attach any stuff to card

Roll all stuff with shaker and return results

result of roll

Example:
    {
        "six_dice": (5, 3, 2, 5),
        "twenty_dice": {2, 12, 4},
    }
class bgameb.tools.Deck(_game: BaseGame, name: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseTool

Create deck for cards

You can add cards, define it counts and deal a deck. Result is saved in dealt attr as deque object. This object has all methods of python deque

Example:
    deque(Card1, Card3, Card2, Card4)
name: Optional[str] = None
dealt: Deque[BaseStuff]
deal() → List[str][source]

Deal new random shuffled deck and save it to self.dealt: List[str]

shuffle() → None[source]

Shuffle dealt deck

to_arrange(start: int, end: int) → Tuple[List[BaseStuff], Tuple[List[BaseStuff]]][source]

Prepare dealt deck to arrange

Parameters

  • start (int) – start of slice

  • end (int) – end of slice

Start and end cant be less than 0 and end must be greater than start. Arranged deck are splited to three part - left, center and right. You can rearrange center part and concatenate that in new deque by arrange() method.

Returns

part to arrange

Return type

Tuple[List[BaseStuff], Tuple[List[BaseStuff]]]

arrange(arranged: List[BaseStuff], last: List[Deque[BaseStuff]]) → None[source]

Compone new dealt deck with given arranged list and last of deck. Use to_arrange() method to get liat to arrange and last of deck before arrange.

Parameters

  • arranged (List[BaseStuff]) – arranged list of cards

  • last – (Deque[BaseStuff]): last of deck deque

search(query: Dict[str, int], remove: bool = True) → List[Card][source]

Search for cards in dealt deck

Parameters

  • query (Dict[str, int]) – dict with name of searched card and count of seartching

  • remove (bool) – if True - remove cards from dealt deck. Default to True

Returns

list of finded cards

Return type

List[Card]

Example:
    game.tools.stuff.deck1.search(
        {'card1': 2,
         'card2': 1 },
        remove=False
        )
clear() → None[source]

Clean dealt deack

bgameb.constructs module

Base constructs for build package objects

class bgameb.constructs.Components(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Mapping

Components mapping.

This class inherit from dict and not implemets __setattr__ and __setitems__. Class represents additional dot-acces for attributes of dict

Args must be a dicts

add(component, **kwargs) → None[source]

Add component to Components dict. Components with same names as existed cant be added.

Raises

ComponentNameError – name id not unique

Parameters

  • component (Component) – component class

  • kwargs – aditional args

Add or replace component in Components dict.

Parameters

  • component (Component) – component class

  • kwargs – aditional args

lisct of names of conatined components

class bgameb.constructs.BaseTool(_game: BaseGame)[source]

Bases: Base, ABC

Base class for game tools (like decks or shakers)

Inherited classes needs attr name implementation

stuff: Components
add(name: str, count: int = 1) → None[source]

Add stuff to the tool stuff collection

Parameters

  • name (str) – name of stuff

  • count (int, optional) – count of stuff copy Defaults to 1.

Raises

StuffDefineError – count of stuff nonpositive or stuff not exist

remove(name: Optional[str] = None, count: Optional[int] = None) → None[source]

Remove any kind of stuff copy from tool by its name and count

Parameters

  • name (str, optional) – name of stuff. Defaults to None.

  • count (int, optional) – count of stuff. Defaults to None.

You can use any combination for names and counts to remove all stuff, all or any by name or by count.

Raises

StuffDefineError – nonpositive integer for count

class bgameb.constructs.BasePlayer[source]

Bases: Base

Base class for game players and bots

Inherited classes needs attr name implementation
